text: The 2013–14 La Liga season (known as the Liga BBVA for sponsorship reasons) was the 83rd since its establishment. The season began on 17 August 2013 and ended on 18 May 2014. == League Table == ==Statistics== ===Top goalscorers=== The Pichichi Trophy is awarded by newspaper Marca to the player who scores the most goals in a season. Rank Player Club Goals 1 Cristiano Ronaldo Real Madrid 31 2 Lionel Messi Barcelona 28 3 Diego Costa Atlético Madrid 27 4 Alexis Sánchez Barcelona 19 5 Karim Benzema Real Madrid 17 6 Carlos Vela Real Sociedad 16 Antoine Griezmann Real Sociedad Aritz Aduriz Athletic Bilbao 9 Gareth Bale Real Madrid 15 Javi Guerra Real Valladolid Pedro Barcelona Kevin Gameiro Sevilla Source: pichichi.es ===Top Assists=== Rank Player Club Assists 1 Ángel Di María Real Madrid 18 2 Koke Atlético Madrid 14 2 Cesc Fàbregas Barcelona 14 3 Gareth Bale Real Madrid 13 4 Carlos Vela Real Sociedad 12 4 Markel Susaeta Athletic Bilbao 12 7 Lionel Messi Barcelona 11 8 Ivan Rakitić Sevilla 10 8 Alexis Sánchez Barcelona 10 10 Karim Benzema Real Madrid 9 10 Cristiano Ronaldo Real Madrid 9 ===Zamora Trophy=== The Zamora Trophy is awarded by newspaper Marca to the goalkeeper with least goals-to-games ratio. Rank Name Club Goals Against Matches Average 1 Thibaut Courtois Atlético Madrid 24 37 2 Gorka Iraizoz Athletic Bilbao 32 33 3 Diego López Real Madrid 36 36 4 Keylor Navas Levante 39 36 5 Sergio Asenjo Villarreal 41 35 === Hat- tricks === Player For Against Result Date Lionel Messi 3–2 (A) 1 September 2013 Mounir El Hamdaoui 5–0 (H) 15 September 2013 Pedro 4–0 (A) 21 September 2013 Cristiano Ronaldo 7–3 (H) 30 October 2013 Youssef El-Arabi 3–1 (H) 8 November 2013 Cristiano Ronaldo 5–1 (H) 9 November 2013 Carlos Vela4 4–3 (H) 23 November 2013 Sergio García 4–1 (A) 24 November 2013 Gareth Bale 4–0 (H) 30 November 2013Gareth Bale Jonas 3–0 (H) 1 December 2013 Javi Guerra 3–0 (H) 16 December 2013 Pedro 5–2 (A) 22 December 2013 Alexis Sánchez 4–0 (H) 5 January 2014 Ikechukwu Uche 5–2 (A) 6 January 2014 Aritz Aduriz 4–0 (H) 28 February 2014 Lionel Messi 7–0 (H) 16 March 2014 Lionel Messi 4–3 (A) 23 March 2014 4 Player scored four goals 5 Player scored five goals (H) – Home ; (A) – Away === Discipline === * Most yellow cards (club): 102 ** Málaga * Most yellow cards (player): 15 ** Alberto Botía (Elche) * Most red cards (club): 8 ** Real Betis ** Rayo Vallecano ** Osasuna * Most red cards (player): 2 ** 6 players == References == 2013-14 La Liga Category:2013 in Europe Category:2014 in Europe Category:Football in Spain Category:2013 in sports Category:2014 in European sport Category:2014 in association football
title: 2013–14 La Liga
